body_html:
Indirect yes. I used the code from #14998 where I hit this bug, but the bug is independent.
Here is the problem (reduced to the minimum) that I need to solve with reshape:

x = tf.placeholder(tf.float32, [None, None, 32, 32])
y = tf.reshape(x, ...)
y.shape == [None, None, 1024]

It would be nice to do the reshape without predicting the shape and/or use set_shape

body:
Indirect yes. I used the code from #14998 where I hit this bug, but the bug is independent.
Here is the problem (reduced to the minimum) that I need to solve with reshape:
```python
x = tf.placeholder(tf.float32, [None, None, 32, 32])
y = tf.reshape(x, ...)
y.shape == [None, None, 1024]
```
It would be nice to do the reshape without predicting the shape and/or use `set_shape`
